text:
Stan Lee was a comic book hero who’ll live through his work for centuries to come. While he created many superheros including Spider man and Iron man, he was called a real-life superhero. Of course, the news of his demise has left everyone across the world mourning in grief.
Even though his health was deteriorating since past couple of years, the news of his death came as a shock to many.
Also Read: Stan Lee, The Man Who Created Spider-Man & Iron Man, Passes Away & All Superheroes Are Mourning
The world has lost a creative genius. But his legacy will live forever. When he was asked what’s on his wish list, he had once told The Daily Beast, “That I leave everyone happy when I leave. Well, I don’t mean happy that I left. Happy that I took the right path.”
AP
He had also thought about his own obituary. In an old interview with American talk show host and comedian Conan O’Brien, Stan Lee had talked about his 50 years in comic books and how he got his start writing celebrity obituary.
AFP

He explained that when a celebrity dies, newspapers come out with their obituaries within 15 minutes of their death, because they have prepared that in advance. “That’s how you know you’re famous,” he said, adding that he hopes someone had prepared one for him too.
“I would love to think somewhere my obituary is in a file. Then I’ll know I made it. I don’t wanna see it too soon, but that’s okay!”
AP
Watch him say this in the video below.
Superheros don’t die, do they? Stan Lee, the real-life superhero, will live through his work forever!
title: In This Old Video, Marvel Comic’s Real-Life Superhero Stan Lee Hoped People Kept His Obituary Ready
